hanzi-su-wiki:
尋

Значения

Искать; спрашивать, справляться; мера длины 1,81 м

Мнемоника

Работать 工, мотая со шпульки 口 нитки обеими руками 寸. Искать (концы ниток). По иной версии — шарить руками в поисках инструмента и спрашивать о нем. Искать место для рытья колодца (зависит от ландшафта).

Варианты

寻, 𢒫, 𡬶

xún
to search; to look for; to seek
искать; искать; искать

寻寻		seek, search, look for, ancient

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 寻)
Ideographic: A hand 彐 looking 工 for an item 口; 寸 provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
尋找 [ xún zhǎo ]: to seek; to look for
尋求 [ xún qiú ]: to seek; to look for
尋常 [ xún cháng ]: usual; common; ordinary
尋覓 [ xún mì ]: to look for
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿳ Above to middle and below
    • 彐 [ jì ] snout
    • ⿰ Left to right
      • 工 [ gōng ] labor, work; laborer, worker
      • 口 [ kǒu ] mouth; entrance, gate, opening
    • 寸 [ cùn ] inch; small, tiny
heisig_chinese_memo: A lot of maids have to keep their mouth glued and work with a broom all day so they often seek a new job.
koohiiStory1: The policed inquired into the erotica scandal. They tried to sweep away the evidence, but some of it stuck. (Note: katakana エロ ero in the middle of this kanji is the Japanese word for erotica.).
koohiiStory2: As a verb this means, this means "to ask; to enquire; to search; to look for; to look into; to investigate;". Imagine the police inquiring in an in-depth investigation. They are interrogating a suspect. But the suspect has a crafty mouth and is very sly. He/she also knows when to keep their mouth shut(glued) at the right moments to avoid self-incrimination. As a final measure, the police torture the suspect by tickling him/her with a broom while they inquire.
WaniKani_Radicals: ヨ, 工, 口, 寸
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Wolverine is doing a construction job and he’s using his mouth to measure so he knows how many folks he needs to inquire about helping him with the job. Using one’s mouth is a strange way to measure something, but that’s just how Wolverine does things. Once he measures it all out, he’ll know how many construction workers he needs to inquire about working for him.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine Wolverine going around, measuring the construction site with his mouth. Look at him with his mouth wide open, wandering around the site deep in thought. What a weirdo.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You decide to inquire as to why Wolverine is using his mouth to measure out this construction site. As you get closer you notice his cool ripped jeans (じん). Instead you inquire how he got such a fresh style. He looks you up and down, pulls out his claws, and tears yours up to match his. You’ve completely forgotten what it was you were asking, but who cares! Look how great you look!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Look down at your ripped up jeans. You’re so fashionable now! Just like good old ‘90s Wolvie.
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 訪 (おとずれる、たずねる、ホウ посещать, приезжать) — другой оттенок того же кунного чтения.
Ru_Words:
訪ねるたずねる
  • спрашивать, запрашивать
  • искать, разыскивать
  • допрашивать — также иногда 訊ねる [たずねる] (редкое кандзи)
  • посещать, навещать кого-л., заходить, заглядывать к кому-л — обычно 尋ねる [たずねる]
    • 尋ね物たずねもの
  • разыскиваемая вещь
    • 尋問じんもん
  • допрос
    • 討尋とうじん
  • внимательный допрос
    • 尋常じんじょう
  • обыкновенный, нормальный, честный
Ru_Radicals: 口 (рот), 寸 (дюйм), 工 (техника), ヨ
Ru_trainchinese: xún: (глаг/сч.слово) искать, разыскивать; старинная мера длины, равная 8 чи (см. 尺)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the mouth (口) gives a yo (ヨ) because he worked (工) an inch (寸) with his inquiry
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If being as clean as possible is what you seek then glue a broom to your fingers.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jinwen from the second " also " (hand shape) from "丨", like stretching out two arms to measure the length. The original meaning of " seeking " is a unit of measurement, derived from the method of arm measurement. The length of the open arms is about eight feet, so one " search " is eight feet (Tang Lan). "Shuowen": "The two arms of saving people are seeking, and the eight feet are also." Or add "簟" (like a mat) as a sound symbol.

"Da Dai Li Ji. "The main line" quotes Confucius: "You know the ruler when you cloth your hands, and you know how to find the elbow." Little Erya. "Degree": "Look, and relax both arms." The so-called "relax elbow" and "relax both arms" mean stretching the arms.

The character " Xun " has many simple and complex forms. Its traditional image is to measure the shape of the banquet ("簟") with open arms, or simplify the banquet to a vertical line, or only the shape of the diastolic arms, or add from Mouth " (Zhan Yinxin).

There are two changes in the writing of the seal script. One is the addition of "口" and "工" between the two hands. This complication is the same phenomenon as " again " becomes " right " and " 𠂇 " becomes " left ". One is to change the " 𠂇 " in the lower part of the inverted book to the original book, and to " inch ". In "Shuowen", "彡" is added in the seal script. From this, it can be seen that the seal script " Xun " is the result of an inconsistency in the synthesizing of " right " and " left " (Zhan Yinxin).

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as sacrificial names and the method of using animals (Xu Zaiguo). Bronze inscriptions are used as the name of the country, and the classics may be used as "鄩". The search for the middle plate: "Search for the middle (zhong) and the remaining middle (zhong) female treasure (disc)". It is also used as a sacrificial name, Qin Gonggui: "Zhang (as) Xunzongyi, and Yihuang (ancestor)". The princes and princes were sacrificed in the ancestral temple and then sacrificed the next day. They were called " Yi " or " Xun ". The ritual of sacrificial offerings is inside the gate of the ancestral temple, which can also be called "Xun Zong" (Shang Zhi 𩡝, Tang Yuming).

The Bamboo Slips of the Warring States Period are used as a measurement unit, "Shangbo Chu Zhushu Six. "Jing Gong Abuse" Jane 10: "The Coin of Holding a Search", that is, holding a cloth with a length of one search.

"Shuowen": "𢒫(Xun), deductive reasoning. Conggong, Congkou, Congyou, Cun, work, mouth, chaos, and Cun, separate rationality. The sound. This agrees with 𤕦. The arms of saving people are seeking, and the eight feet are also."
humanum_short_description_en: A gold inscription stretches out its arms and measures its length. The arms stretched out are about eight feet long, so one " search " is eight feet.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文從二「又」(手形)從「丨」，象伸開兩臂，量度長度之形。「尋」的本義是量度單位，源于伸臂量度之法。張開兩臂的長度大約是八尺，故一「尋」即八尺(唐蘭)。《說文》：「度人之兩臂爲尋，八尺也。」或加從「簟」(象席形)為聲符。

　　《大戴禮記．主言》引孔子語：「布手知尺，舒肘知尋。」《孔叢子．小爾雅．度》：「尋，舒兩肱也。」所謂「舒肘」、「舒兩肱」者，即舒展兩臂之意。

　　「尋」字有繁簡多體，其繁體象張開兩臂量度筵席(「簟」)之形，或將筵席簡化為一條豎線，或只剩下舒張兩臂之形，或加從「口」(詹鄞鑫)。

　　篆書的寫法有兩個變化，一是在兩手之間增加「口」和「工」，這種繁化與「又」變為「右」，「𠂇」變為「左」是相同的現象。一是將下部倒書的「𠂇」改為正書，並訛為「寸」。《說文》篆文則另加表音的「彡」。由此可知篆書「尋」正是由「右」、「左」合成的會意字訛變而成的(詹鄞鑫)。

　　甲骨文用作祭名，亦為用牲之法(徐在國)。金文用作國名，典籍或作「鄩」，尋仲盤：「尋中(仲)賸中(仲)女子寶般(盤)」。又用作祭名，秦公簋：「乍(作)尋宗彝，以卲皇且(祖)」。天子、諸侯在宗廟正祭後，次日再祭，稱為「繹」，又稱「尋」。而祭祀之禮在宗廟門內，又可稱「尋宗」(商志𩡝、唐鈺明)。

　　戰國竹簡用作量度單位，《上博楚竹書六．競公虐》簡10：「執尋之幣」，即執持長度為一尋的布帛。

　　《說文》：「𢒫(尋)，繹理也。从工、从口、从又、从寸，工、口，亂也，又、寸，分理之。彡聲。此與𤕦同意。度人之兩臂爲尋，八尺也。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文象伸開兩臂，量度長度。兩臂張開約長八尺，故一「尋」即八尺。

尋ねる(たずねる): ask

甲金文從二「 又 」(手形)從「 丨 」，象伸開兩臂，量度長度之形。「 尋 」的本義是量度單位，源于伸臂量度之法。張開兩臂的長度大約是八尺，故一「 尋 」即八尺(唐蘭)。《說文》：「度人之兩臂爲尋，八尺也。」或加從「 簟 」(象席形)為聲符。 《大戴禮記．主言》引孔子語：「布手知尺，舒肘知尋。」《孔叢子．小爾雅．度》：「尋，舒兩肱也。」所謂「舒肘」、「舒兩肱」者，即舒展兩臂之意。 「 尋 」字有繁簡多體，其繁體象張開兩臂量度筵席(「 簟 」)之形，或將筵席簡化為一條豎線，或只剩下舒張兩臂之形，或加從「 口 」(詹鄞鑫)。 篆書的寫法有兩個變化，一是在兩手之間增加「 口 」和「 工 」，這種繁化與「 又 」變為「 右 」，「 𠂇 」變為「 左 」是相同的現象。一是將下部倒書的「 𠂇 」改為正書，並訛為「 寸 」。《說文》篆文則另加表音的「 彡 」。由此可知篆書「 尋 」正是由「 右 」、「 左 」合成的會意字訛變而成的(詹鄞鑫)。 甲骨文用作祭名，亦為用牲之法(徐在國)。金文用作國名，典籍或作「 鄩 」，尋仲盤：「尋中(仲)賸中(仲)女子寶般(盤)」。又用作祭名，秦公簋：「乍(作)尋宗彝，以卲皇且(祖)」。天子、諸侯在宗廟正祭後，次日再祭，稱為「 繹 」，又稱「 尋 」。而祭祀之禮在宗廟門內，又可稱「尋宗」(商志𩡝、唐鈺明)。 戰國竹簡用作量度單位，《上博楚竹書六．競公虐》簡10：「執尋之幣」，即執持長度為一尋的布帛。 《說文》：「𢒫(尋)，繹理也。从工、从口、从又、从寸，工、口，亂也，又、寸，分理之。彡聲。此與𤕦同意。度人之兩臂爲尋，八尺也。」

Name meaning

xún, xín
вм. 寻
Radicals: ヨ, 工, 口, 寸  (wolverine, construction, mouth, measurement)
Meaning Mnemonic
Wolverine is doing a construction job and he’s using his mouth to measure so he knows how many folks he needs to inquire about helping him with the job. Using one’s mouth is a strange way to measure something, but that’s just how Wolverine does things. Once he measures it all out, he’ll know how many construction workers he needs to inquire about working for him.
Imagine Wolverine going around, measuring the construction site with his mouth. Look at him with his mouth wide open, wandering around the site deep in thought. What a weirdo.
Reading Mnemonic
You decide to inquire as to why Wolverine is using his mouth to measure out this construction site. As you get closer you notice his cool ripped jeans (じん). Instead you inquire how he got such a fresh style. He looks you up and down, pulls out his claws, and tears yours up to match his. You’ve completely forgotten what it was you were asking, but who cares! Look how great you look!
Look down at your ripped up jeans. You’re so fashionable now! Just like good old ‘90s Wolvie.

Examples: 尋ねる (たず.ねる)
口 (рот), 寸 (дюйм), 工 (техника), ヨ
Сравни: 訪 (おとずれる、たずねる、ホウ посещать, приезжать) — другой оттенок того же кунного чтения.
訪ねるたずねる
  • спрашивать, запрашивать
  • искать, разыскивать
  • допрашивать — также иногда 訊ねる [たずねる] (редкое кандзи)
  • посещать, навещать кого-л., заходить, заглядывать к кому-л — обычно 尋ねる [たずねる]
    • 尋ね物たずねもの
  • разыскиваемая вещь
    • 尋問じんもん
  • допрос
    • 討尋とうじん
  • внимательный допрос
    • 尋常じんじょう
  • обыкновенный, нормальный, честный
